59NytAgP7qojkU_6uSrHLg.text: Great food and great staff, can't ask for more! It's super cozy and welcoming and has an amazing tea selection. Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

U_Fe2ANLZOV_sx5C3xr4qQ.text: Read about this place for the best haggis in Edinburgh and new we had to come! Got their special as well as 2 types of whiskey and the cauliflower soup. Great food, huge portions, this place did not disappoint in that sector.   *****however, I checked in and showed the waitress the 10% off coupon but she at first did no then showed another staff the code, then told me to mark it as redeemed, however I never got the discount.. :(

dLsw-HYqPSzFpiBpfKUKzw.text: Great location, slow service and goodish food. We arrived about 15 mins after they opened and it took the server about 10 mins to take our order only after i asked. My husband got haggis and goats cheese wrap served wirh chips salad and a cup of garlic soup. He loved his wrap and the salad and chips were really good too. However the soup was cold and not very tasty. I had a chicken wrap but there was barely any chicken in it just salad and garlic mayo.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nice mix of seating.
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Nice view from our table. Love the cool top hat lights.

sO27N_-fSL9AuRkCTLyvKw.text: What I Ordered: Haggis Tower Flavor: This was my first time trying haggis and it did not dissapoint.  Everything about it was SO flavorful. It's a traditional haggis tower with mashed turnips, mashed potatoes and a dark whiskey gravy. Service: Very attentive and friendly. Atmosphere: A cool pub atmosphere with nice, warm decor. Price: Good for the quality you get. Location: Centrally located in old town Edinburgh Other Comments:  This was my favorite meal during my time in Edinburgh and I would definitely come back here for the haggis!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis Tower

CiUkkwslsOgSI4HHszMZqg.text: Quaint setting, beautiful presentation, nice service. Haggis is supposed to be the best in town. My husband loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis

JVYltzBYyZfyxlJ7O_nZOQ.text: Nice and attentive waiters. Cool atmosphere, the local's decoration is carefully designed, in a Valencian Ruzafa way, lots of old stuff combined with modern items and pieces of art. It's not quite expensive, we ordered more than we could eat and it costed around 16 per person. The food is traditional Scottish and pretty good. I must recommend  Edinburgh sausages and, of course, Robert B's Haggis. All this combined makes a perfect place to go and have a quiet and good dinner, in a relaxing atmosphere.

zYosfglIeLqcMTp_i-UcaQ.text: Ambiance is great...great location, huge fun chairs, cool decor and large windows for a great street view, but the staff ruined it for us.  Went in for some whiskey tasting...ordered the "luxury flight" which was supposed to showcase whiskey from the different areas of Scotland.. but when the sampler was brought out there was no explanation on which one was which, the "areas" shown on the boards, didn't match up to the "areas" on the menu as far as the whiskeys listed on the "luxury flight"...it was impossible to figure out...two of the whiskeys even apparently came from the same area, so then...what's the point?  We asked the staff for help, but they were more defensive than helpful, and didn't seem to understand the problem (so we just gave up).   Our waitress with her "super hipster" hairstyle didn't smile at us once and she seemed more focused on complaining about lack of radios, some billing issues, and stressing out about no longer taking reservations on Saturdays with her co-workers than helping us.   I used to bartend and be a server.  We always learned to keep that type of talk to "back of house" and smile at guests, not make them feel like they are a nuisance.  It was a very awkward and uncomfortable experience.   Maybe the "secret room" side of this place was better..but I'd recommend going to a less "cool" place for you haggis and whiskey.

naYrbFpdQbnjRy0ffyw0tg.text: They make very delicate haggis, but I'm not really a haggis person. The whiskey sauce is quite good and whiskey is also the best one I ever had! Love the cheesecake a lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Decorations
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis

xu4x2MdB6MpRQUMUtBtwew.text: Once I got in.. I left after 5 hours.. It all started with a lunch.. Then a cup of tea.. And finally a bottle of wine (one of the best.. Don't remember the name..but is was an Italian one)  When I got in I loved the place, the decorations and the comfortable chairs!! When I saw the menu.. I felt that it was quite expensive.. But then I saw the portion and believe me.. It worths it..   Overall, friendly service, lovely environment.. Excellent music choices..   This will be in the schedule again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Rose wine and cheese starter!
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. THE haggis...!! Yummy right?
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken salad!! Light and delicious!

d9wGsoFEAWtn1w927qyi1g.text: Haggis was amazing. The vodka bar upstairs was good, but prices were a little high and service was slow.

IkKh7CymF7U9BD4pRd15fg.text: This was my only time eating haggis, but it was delicious. I had the Eggs Ben Nevis and it was very tasty. Bloody Mary is decent- they'll give you Tabasco to spice it up (which you'll want to do if you're American). They were a bit slow on this occasion, but we were there during Fringe, so I think many restaurants experience a surge at this time. However, knowing that, I feel like maybe they needed another staff (either waitstaff or kitchen staff) to keep up. Otherwise, very friendly service and definitely the best haggis I've can imagine.

mien3FeWim_yWxcEPjDPVA.text: Hard to imagine a better place for a better haggis. Ambiance: A little eccentric - something like a cross between a comfy cafe, a tiny bar but not much like a restaurant. Small tables and big old armchairs and a small bar (and check out the ceiling lights). Small, comfy and friendly. Service: Given the fact that there are really only 6 tables it's not surprising that you get well taken care of.  Food: I came here expressly for the haggis. I had the Princess Di one (with a Drambuie sauce). Could really taste the Drambuie, but it was terrific nonetheless. The haggis is served in the more modern deconstructed style which is more common these days and but whatever - it tasted great. But as much as I loved it, I couldn't finish it all as it was a sizeable portion and very rich.  Price: You'd be paying 50% more for a similar meal in the States, and it's definitely worth it for a special haggis and scotch night out. If I ever make it back to Edinburgh I'd make sure of going here again.

gRHJPIdAXrgFJ-P9p3dfOw.text: They say this bar has the best Haggis in Edinburgh... its True!!! That's why I chose it as the place to go to for me and my wife's quick visit to this fantastic city. She never had haggis before so had to go to the best place. There was a few people in when we went , the atmosphere and feel of the place is good , the service was quick and friendly ....and the price not too bad. It has a very good selection of whiskies.... I mean very very good. Filling the shelves on the wall behind bar. We both ordered haggis.... mine in a whiskey sauce.  It came out presented on the plate beautifully like a multi coloured tower.... on top the Haggis, then turnip and at the bottom the mashed potato. Delicious!!!! Everything was just perfect and so lived up to the reputation of being the best. So much so I could have eaten another!!!.  All in all I got to say it must be the best....and if you ever there try it and you won't regret.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The Haggis!!!....beautiful!!!

-2BX76wHM5Rlo80wnD7qTg.text: I was told that they have the best haggis in town and it's True. Tried the Princess Diana haggis and it was excellent. The mushroom cream sauce is a good compliment to the stack of liver meat, sweet potato mash, and mashed potato. Recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Said to be the best haggis in Edinburgh.

zXL6CMxFVCDHINeWFs5B3A.text: This was one of our favourite finds in Edinburgh. We actually found it in an advert in the back of one of the tourist booklets and thought twice about going because we thought it would be full of tourists (we prefer getting involved with the locals!).  We went for it anyway and were so glad we did. We showed up at about 10pm, quite late I admit, but they were still serving food. The decor inside the place was really lovely, relaxing and warm although the place is quite small. There were two women enjoying a late dinner on one side and a couple having a drink on the other side. Then us. Very nice.   The menu is lovely - some really good choices and their drinks menu is also extensive (there's a reason why they are called the Haggis and Whiskey house!).   My boyfriend went for the haggis which was tasty. The mashed potato was a little bland for me but overall it was good.   I had king prawns "slowly roasted in a garlic, thyme and soy sauce" in a salad. It was supposed to come with crusty bread and Marie Rose sauce...No crusty bread, but normal bread toasted (understandable given the time of day we turned up!) and no Marie Rose sauce (although with the soy sauce I would have thought this a bit of a weird combination....). Best part: the king prawns were absolutely gigantic. Lovely.  We loved this place so much we came back in the morning for breakfast! The breakfast was equally as nice. We went for the Glasgow Potato Scones with scrambled eggs and smoked salmon. Delicious.   No faults at all with this place. Highly recommended.

WEQWJI0KMgL4ruTAy-yL9g.text: I came here for dinner with a couple friends while traveling in the UK, one of whom lived in Scotland for a while.  My boyfriend and I wanted to try haggis, of course, being tourists and all, so our friend brought us to this place on Cockburn [insert joke here] St, right behind were we were staying at St. Christopher's Inn.  If you are ever to visit this place, make sure you get the whiskey sauce (worth the 2 or whatever pounds it costs).  It makes the haggis a lot more flavorful and not as heavy/dry.  I guess since I'd never had it anywhere else, I can't really compare it to any other place.  I can, however, tell you that it was different, but delicious.  Tastes kind of like ground up flavorful liver-like stuff on top of sweet potatoes on top of mashed potatoes.  The food was enjoyable, minus the fact that there was quite a bit too much pepper in the ground-up meat itself.  So much pepper that I couldn't really taste anything else.  That's the only reason for my 5-minus-1 star rating.  Not a very busy place, has a full bar I believe.  Service is great though.

ftB0fnzraGJkhdEXNcIkzg.text: Shockingly disappointing food. This place claims to be a whisky and haggis house, but the haggis tasted like it came from a ready meal in a supermarket. The famous sausages were burnt on the outside and were no better than what you can get at train stations or football stadiums. Avoid at all costs. Clearly a tourist trap. The London Insider london-insider.co.uk

F7iRcnOSuax80XA7JIk7fg.text: Great haggis. Got the famous Robert haggis with his key sauce. As others have said, it did not disappoint. We also had the fish cakes. The fish was really well cooked and mixed together. The chilli mayo was amazing! Highly recommend this place. Great value for the food!

3EuCe6aGSzgGJOfAvdIAuQ.text: The place *looked* nice, the haggis *tasted* good--but my girlfriend and I both had food poisoning (immediately) afterwards. Made our last night in Scotland a pretty unpleasant experience. Cannot recommend.

Kjznb2QyYfFmzxmDduZxlw.text: A nice little pub, and, for my first time, haggis.  I was a visitor, and was recommended Arcade for haggis.  It did not disappoint.  If you're wanting to try haggis for the first time, are in old town Edinburgh, try this place.  My wife had the vegetarian, liked it as well.

aDxJ4KKwl41eyUKFOUBjtA.text: We were four people who had just flown into Edinburgh and who did not want to succumb to jet lag so we were walking around the central part of town. When it occurred to us that we should find somewhere for lunch, we happened to be in the touristic centre of town, so we feared we'd either find a place that was just awful or that was OK but overpriced. We liked the look of this place and staggered in, and even though there was a short wait for a table to come free, we decided it looked promising enough to wait.  The decor is quirky, with tables surrounded by mismatched chairs that look like they could belong in an office or a parlour. The menu is interesting, with a range of Scottish dishes on offer at what seemed to us fair prices. Intrigued by the promise of Edinburgh's best haggis, our order included two haggis-containing dishes: the Robert Burns (haggis stacked with potatoes and turnips) and a chicken stuffed with haggis. Other dishes we ordered were the sausages and a cheese plate. All the dishes were fantastic, but the haggis was the definite star of the show, very tasty and without the offal smell that sometimes can come with poorly made haggis. We were definite fans.  To top it off, the service was very friendly and professional. This was a great first meal of our Scotland visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken stuffed with haggis
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sausages with mashed potatoes
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cheese plate

MIy1lOLtJRnGoaOb0OXw-A.text: Loved the food and whisky at this great little bar just off the Royal Mile. The Haggis Burger is fabulous, and a decent whisky selection compliments it well.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis burger with chips

TPCeSeDamNGWf17zigIbFA.text: The most edible haggis. Exceeded my expectations and a charming spot, to boot.    Basically, I came here to try haggis and drink scotch.  This place was one of three that is known for their haggis being the best (I like it say the most edible).  I chose here not only for the "best" reviews or the prime location, but because of the warm and charm it exudes as you walk past it.  You don't even need to come here for haggis.  Just come in because it looks like the place to be.  Let me tell you what I ate and some flavor notes.  Haggis bon bons- seasoned, fried, comes with a balsamic gastrique and crispy kale.  Barely gritty, not offal-like at all, pleasant and palatable. Kale is a nice touch, in terms of texture.  Cheese plate: Hebridean blue, smoked Auld Reekie, Island is Mull cheddar, caramelized onions, herbed olives, Kerrygold butter, grapes. The reekie and cheddar were good cheeses on their own.  The blue was by far the most versatile in terms of pairings with the scotches and accoutrements.    Scotch whisky: Scapa, Dalwhinnie 15, Auchebtoshan Bruichladdich, Glenlivet 12.  Scapa and Bruichladdich paired best with cheddar/no accoutrements.  Reekie best with Scapa, Auchentoshan, and Dalwhinnie.  Blue cheese best with Bruichladdich and Glenlivet, and onions.  Would love to hear anyone else's tasting notes!  Hope you enjoy this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scottish cheese board
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis bon bons
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whisky!

uRQ8ElwX6tgfcewBqOk_CQ.text: we popped our head in to Arcade after a long journey up to Arthur's Seat with our friend Yan C! We all ordered beers to start and food to follow. I ordered the lamb burger, Yan got the Haggis & Kenyon got the fish & chips. All dishes were delicious we tried one another's. With Haggis being a Scottish dish I couldn't leave without trying a bite of Yan's. It was incredible and presentable! The French fries were thick and not as salted as I'm used to in America. Definitely recommend to stop on in!

JR5dvjns0JWWi1InBbWKYQ.text: I was very hesitant to try haggis. Read many things online that made it seem very unappetizing until I read a review on Reddit about how this place has the best haggis in the world. I'm always interested in trying new food so I definitely had to try the best haggis in the world. I was in Edinburgh for the day and my partner and I stopped by. It's a smaller venue so if you try to go on a weekend or holiday definitely book/call in advance.  My partner had the deconstructed steak and ale pie while I had the haggis served in a whiskey sauce. The haggis along with the whiskey sauce was one of the most flavourful thing I have ever tasted. It was so good that I went back twice more on seperate vacations. I will always try to stop by this place when I visit Edinburgh. Definitely going back

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Deconstructed steak and ale pie
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis in whiskey sauce

MQzJq5uHiDparSMaXEuekA.text: Like Haggis?   Like Scottish Whiskey?   Not sure and just want to give it a go?   Then this is a place for you.  Very cozy. Cute eclectic decorum with a small pub-like feel.    The haggis with whiskey sauce is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Whiskey, cider &amp; Old Fashioned.
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis w/ whiskey sauce
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Deconstructed steak pie

epsOHEx3IXy-YB0vPR8bWg.text: On the quest to try haggis, I had read that Arcade had the best. I didn't dare ruin my first haggis experience at somewhere subpar, and I'm glad I chose Arcade.   We arrived without reservations around 5:30pm, and it was busy but not full. We sat upstairs in a nice area with a bar. The male server from Czech was especially great, helping me choose how to sauce haggis (go for the Whisky sauce!).   Overall, highly recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Ndt4yeP6_0SdvEkk55uWTw.text: I really enjoyed my time here because they deconstruct what you imagine haggis to be and put a spin on it that I can only describe as post modern.

TPauFvp-qosLsLP2R7u4gg.text: Amazing meal!!  Highly recommend the hagis bom boms as a starter - the hagis was top notch!!   Extensive whisky selection.   Busy place so arrive early!!  Staff were very efficient and friendly.   Enjoy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Top hat lights

SNzCuuI65Qm3OG8QyPbyBw.text: At the end of a very long day site seeing and walking miles we started up Cockburn street on the way back to our hotel. Absolutey exhausted we decided the only way to fortify ourselves for the rest of the climb (we live in Ohio which is very flat) was for food and whisky. This turned out be a great choice the haggis, neeps and tatties  tower was delicious and the bar tender recommended a great scotch whisky (I am now a convert to scotch, bourbon had been my favorite).

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, neeps and tatties

fQR9tHfntNeUKY9h5QBp2g.text: Stoping here for a few whiskey samples and some fried haggis is always a good idea, if they have a table available ...

I4cCZ8-6tAfvtlxVigpqwg.text: Stopped in for a quick drink, stayed for the fish and chips. Service was good; food tasty.  Nice scotch selection.

ivMCxdvKsYdHp6ImN56NfA.text: Great little restaurant. Stopped in for a quick bite. Ordered the Haggis Bon Bon and Scottish cheese board. Never had haggis before and the Bon bons were delicious and filling. The cheese board was good and had 3 different cheeses, cheddar, smoked and blue. The Hebridean blue was the best out of the 3 cheeses.

Os4MpzzsEVPdSTpHyTOplQ.text: My very first encounter with haggis, and I am SO glad this was where I went!!!  First of all, there is an entire section of the menu devoted to tea, which made me insanely happy. My boyfriend had an entire section devoted to whisky, so he was happy too!   We went with the Princess Diana-style haggis, which came with a creamy Drambuie sauce that was perfect for the hearty dish. What is haggis like? For Americans, compare it to crumbly meatloaf or the meat portion of shepard's pie. It's hearty and delicious and the portion is huge if you are really hungry, and perfect to share if you want to try it without stuffing your tummy full and THEN have to walk around all day.  They claim it's the best haggis in town, and while we only tried one more from another restaurant, I'm inclined to agree. The flavor is really nice, and they really do take pride in making it special. Don't be afraid, you only live once. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

fHCv1lWCsy-Fuqlxkv9_mg.text: If you're going to try Haggis for the first time in Edinburgh, this is place to do it. I brought my 15 year old and he loved it. Its a great place to chill out and have a drink also.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The haggis...
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Inside
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The front of the building

3nYx0xojty78UzJrtX0ggA.text: My boyfriend and I ate here our first night in town, eager to try the haggis and other local cuisine. We absolutely loved Arcade Bar.   We came later in the night so we were among the only people there but the waitstaff was very friendly. We sat at a table in the window and started with a cheese plate, which was pretty killer. Not a huge fan of bleu cheese normally but loved this one.   He ate the Princess Diana Haggis & I had the deconstructed steak & ale pie. I'm allergic to mushrooms so its normally hard for me to find a meat pie that I can eat, so not only was I beyond excited to have found one, but it was absolutely delicious as well. This was our first attempt of haggis and we LOVED IT.   We actually ate it at a few different places and out of the ones we tried, this was definitely the best haggis town!

0pFrRhWCOuYeuVrFhFqcNA.text: Had 3 types of whiskies and tomato and goat cheese bruschetta. The whiskies were delicious. Scapa, Glengoyne and another Scottish Whisky. Quite tasty. The appetiser portion was small and the service was quite slow. However the ambience is very nice and warm.

dAJsgfmg9E7khPaWFwOFyQ.text: This was the perfect place to try haggis for the first time. It's located in city center, in an old heritage building and offers several authentic Scottish dishes.  I had the Princess Diana haggis, which came with mashed potatoes and a delicious cream sauce. The whole dish tasted great. It's also good value as I was unable to finish the whole portion. I didn't try any whisky here, but it looked like they had a good list on their menu.

ZhpXgtxo_djORtgQAVlESA.text: Gluten free haggis! Heck yeah. When in Scotland, one must try haggis. Or at least that's how I feel. When I found out that they served gluten free haggis here, I was delighted. They serve it with nips and tatties. (Turnips and potatoes) I had the princess diane style, which was amazing. The sauce is creamy and rich.  The waitstaff were tentative and nice. The decor was awesome a welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Love the light fixtures
Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gluten free haggis princess diane style

H7dT5HBCzHs_E6JnFzmWbw.text: I really enjoyed my first time to try Haggis and would recommend it. I got mine with the whisky sauce but could not taste any whisky which is probably a good thing. It just tasted like a very good and savory brown gravy. I asked the server she assured me there was whisky in the sauce. I am thinking maybe a eye dropper full. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Arcade - Haggis and Whisky House - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Haggis, Neeps and Tatties with whisky sauce
